availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Wadsworth (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm worker and soldier)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm worker and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Thompson Wadsworth. Father of Mary A. Wadsworth, John F. Wadsworth, Nancy Wadsworth, and Sarah Wadsworth. Farm worker in Pendleton County in 1860. Enlisted as a wagoner in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on July 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 54.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272800, p. 26-27.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 194.
Find A Grave, "Pvt John Stickle Wadsworth (September 27, 1825-November 8, 1908)," Memorial #9487535, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9487535 (accessed June 13, 2018).
